definitions.definition: used to talk about a man in a friendly way

examples.text: He isn't such a bad chap really.
Come on, chaps, let’s go now!
He's a decent sort of chap.
The poor old chap was very shaken by the experience.

wordOrigin: late 16th cent. (denoting a buyer or customer): abbreviation of chapman ‘pedlar’. The current sense dates from the early 18th cent.
